page.title: 05Clubs
page.content: No clubs have their meeting place in this block, but many draw support from people living here. The men who spend long hours either working on the land or commuting tend not to be as clubable as their womenfolk. Nearest clubs are the Stanford Bishop WI and the youth club both of which operate from the parish hall and draw membership from broad cross section of the population. Many belong to Young Farmers Clubs though none meet nearby. Children join guides and scouts. The Flower, Garden, and Local History societies meet in Bromyard and have local members. The Bromyard and District Riding Club originated in the area. These clubs give an opportunity of meeting and exchanging information on a regular basis in what could otherwise be quite isolated lives.
